reviewText:
Early Access Review

Clearly inspired by pokemon, which isn't a problem. If you're into the pokemon formula then you've got a pretty good idea about what Minimon is trying to accomplish.

Except don't bother. This game is terrible.

But the game is early access! You should expect some bumps!" you might say
date: and you'd be absolutely right. I've played many early access games and greatly enjoyed them. This one
hoursPlayed: is shockingly bad. The graphics are terrible
voteText: the animations are worse
helpfulPercent: the controls are awkward and disjointed
votesHelpful: the sound comes and goes as it pleases
votesTotal: the dialogue reads as if it's been run through google translate
commentsCount: menus haphazarldy transition or dissappear all together at random
column16: scripted NPC behavior often sends them running to walls or vanishing mid-sentence
column17: there's intense lag (even in single player!)
column18: and so on.\n\nThe whole thing feels like a first attempt at making a game- the sort of thing you'd expect from a high school senior who's still learning the finer points of javascript. Instead it's tucked among other actual games
column19: boasting positive reviews from people I can only assume are friends of the developer. It's a train wreck and everyone's on fire.\n\nBut really
column20: this should all be excusable. After all
column21: it's early access. Except it's not. It's awful. The game would have to be scrapped and rebuilt from the ground up to be salvagable. The developed expects this game to be finished in roughly 5 months (as of this review) which includes "player suggestions." This is basically the game you're getting.\n\nEven were it free it wouldn't be worth your time. If you want the pokemon experience on your computer try Pokemon Zeta Omicron
column23: or even Pokemon Legends. This game doesn't deliver."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very promising, but very rough and far from complete

Laggy and not smooth environment.
Mouse click is very buggy, i have to place my mouse cursor 1-2 cm below the actual button position on screen to click the button

Promising, but
If you're looking for insta-gaming experience, do not buy it now, but later when it's close to final version

There's no reason to buy this game now, unless if you got this very cheap (in bundle, 99%disc, etc) or if you want to help the funding of the development

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*Most Recent Review from this is October 24, 2015.

Hello to everyone who wish to purchase this game, but have difficulty if they want to. This is the review that you SHOULD read instead of the past reviews. Let's begin...

Storyline:
Minimon's storyline is very unique from other games that are an innovation of Pokemon because it involves your family, criminals, and the urge to become the best! monster hunter (trainer). The theme can clearly be seen as a mix of good and evil and the importance of family.
Rate: 8/10

Gameplay Time:
Next, the game's storyline is much more time consuming compared to other games. I recently discovered an article stating that for every hour of gameplay there is in a game is $1.00. I currently have at this time 62.3 hours of gameplay, and have not completed the storyline yet (including leveling monsters). It appears that this game produces a large amount of content considering it being in early development.
Rate: 10/10

Creativity:
Surely most of you have seen at least one Pokemon game that was not produced by Game Freak, one of Nintendo's subsidary corperation. It also enables the customer to purchase the game for free. However, this game does not because of it's originality, to a certain extent. The regions are orginal, the 'gym leaders' are orginal, the monsters are orginal, etc...
Rate: 5/10
Reason: Reminds me of Pokemon

Minor Details:
Too many to explain.
Rate: 10/10

Bugs:
KEEP IN MIND THIS SHOULD NOT INHIBIT YOU FROM BUYING THIS GAME, NOW OR LATER IN THE FUTURE.
Yes, I agree there are minor bugs to this game. However, the game is still playable.
Rate: Can't rate bugs...ladybug is pretty hot though

Complaints:
More animations
Rate: 9/10

Personal Experience:
I recently stated I have currently played this game for 62.3 hours. I have been playing since June/July and have not regreted purchasing this game. You are capable of playing online or offline, which is the beuty of this game. I have encountered countless bugs, but most, if not all, have been fixed.
Rate: 10/10

Developer(s):
The developer of this game is known as Sushi. He responds to problems or questions that members of the community posts within 24 hours. He is very helpful and wishes the best for the game. If the game contains minor bugs/glitches, he will fix it within that week. If he does not respond, then the co-developer(?) responds helping in any way he can. It appears he wants the best for the game, including Sushi.
Rate: 10/10

Average Rate: 8.86/10
Should you purchase the game? Yes; make sure you limit yourself from playing too much.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sadly in the case of Minimon it does far more wrong than it does right. The overall direction seems very contrived yet not very controlled, leaving the whole experience feeling very cobbled together with no real direction in mind. Perhaps in the future Minimon might have some sort of potential to be what it aims to be, but it would need a massive overhaul to come anywhere close to what it aspires to be. For a game inspired by what is to some, one of the greatest franchises of all time, it takes very little that what makes it great, trying to improve on it and ultimately failing.

More details and a full analysis can be found in my video preview below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UHjeWGqaU7s

Disclaimer: I was given a Steam code by someone I personally know who worked on the game - to assess it. I hold no biases, but keep this in mind as you hear what I have to say on the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far I have enjoyed what I've played of 'Minimon', it's a Pokemon-esque game with the online component we've always looked for.

See personally I've been a huge fan of Pokemon, however, I've always wanted to played something like Pokemon but, in an mmorpg world.
Minimon has done that in it's own take of the monster underground slave trade genre. (Seriously, these games are about people enslaving animals and having them fight each other)

From what I've played the story seems silly to me (really both parents leave? how old is the protaganist like 13? Good luck son! Go out and fight all those scary monsters!")

Dad goes off to find a cure for moms illness
date: and surprise doesn't return! So a year after he abandones his family
recommended:
mom decides to go find a cure herself. Seems legit.

The monsters are still somehow unique enough that you wouldn't call them clones of any pokemon (At least the ones I've seen so far) Although during my playthrough I was still yelling Chansey at one of them.

If you want a game thats a little pokemon
hoursPlayed: a little final fantasy and a little mmorpg with cute 3d graphics then I'd totally check out 'Minimon' and if you don't pick it up today
voteText:
I'd at least keep an eye on it cause I think it will build a dedicated following as long as the dev's keep at it.

I'm uploading a first look that takes place 30 minutes in (I had to delete the first video because it showed my account password =/ why it shows it in plain text is beyond me lol).

https://youtu.be/1vbDanyFHMg

For more reviews and a bi-weekly podcast about Early Access and Indie games check out www.EarlyAccessPodcast.com"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow, you know, I really wanted to give this game a shot. There is just way too much input lag though. Maybe it's because I was playing online though, I don't know. On top of that, the game also ran at a ♥♥♥♥ poor frame rate, and character models just sometimes freaked out for no reason.

Also, I got stuck on menus multiple times, and had to manually close the game by stopping the process since I couldn't even click the exit button on the window.

Technical bugs aside, the combat didn't flow well at all. I also had a lot of trouble using items. Like, I couldn't use healing items for some reason, and the way you throw the net to capture your monster is by declining to use the item, then saying you want to use the item.

Maybe I'll come back to it once it's out of Early Access, but as of right now, the game is pretty awful, and you can take it from me, I usually just do joke reviews for games that offend me.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I see-saw on recomending this game:

The game is buggy, but has improved immensely since I first bought it. The devs are actively trying to improve on it. It's fun if you like monster catching, and is slowly drifting away from the pokemon clone roots.

However, what you pay right now in early access is to beta-test these builds, large feedback for better information for improvements and unless you're wanting to deal with some issues, the game is not worth 10$ right now. I don't really regret buying the game as I get to watch it develop, but that's not for everyone.

Things I would like that I haven't discovered and may not exist:
An ability to hide my helm so I can have my pretty hair back
Nicknaming monsters
Being able to register my fishing pole again. that option vanished =(

reviewText:
Early Access Review

RECEIVED A KEY FOR REVIEW

As you can see I have not played very much but I will try to update this review when I play more.

Currently, Minimon has quite a few of bugs but that shouldn't keep you from getting it. It is like Pokemon, where you capture monsters and fight with them.

Gameplay-
Minimon is a turned based game meaning you control your monster and take turns attacking. You also use your character to fight. You have options of what you do in a battle such as, attacking it or using an item. The gameplay is like Pokemon so if you like Pokemon, you'll most likely like Minimon. Rating: 8/10 There's also local co op so yay for that!

Customization-
When creating your character, you can change what your character looks like and more. However, when I created my character, some of the options didn't work(guessing they weren't created yet). Rating: 6/10

Storyline-
I haven't finished the game yet, but for the time I played it, the storyline was pretty good. No Spoilers :D Rating: 8/10

Price-
The game is currently 10 dollars as of 1/27/2016. For the time I've played it, I don't think the game is worth $10. However, the game is in Early Access so, my opinion may change. Definitely get it when it's on sale though. Rating: 5/10

Graphics-
Looking at the pictures the game looks great. Sure it's not next gen level graphics but it's fine. In game, the game looks good and runs smoothly. 8/10

Overall Rating: 7/10
